documents.instruction: Create a PlantUML activity diagram with nested branches and multiple decision points.
documents.output:
@startuml
(*) --> if "Some Test" then
  -->[true] "action 1"
  if "" then
    -> "action 3" as a3
  else
    if "Other test" then
      -left-> "action 5"
    else
      --> "action 6"
    endif
  endif
else
  ->[false] "action 2"
endif
a3 --> if "last test" then
  --> "action 7"
else
  -> "action 8"
endif
@enduml

documents.instruction: Create a PlantUML activity diagram with partitions showing a conductor, audience, and orchestra.
Generate a PlantUML activity diagram with custom colors and fonts using skinparam.
documents.output:
@startuml
skinparam backgroundColor #AAFFFF
skinparam activity {
  StartColor red
  BarColor SaddleBrown
  EndColor Silver
  BackgroundColor Peru
  BackgroundColor<< Begin >> Olive
  BorderColor Peru
  FontName Impact
}
(*) --> "Climbs on Platform" << Begin >>
--> === S1 ===
--> Bows
--> === S2 ===
--> WavesArmes
--> (*)
@enduml
documents.text:
Diagram type: activity
Instruction: Generate a PlantUML activity diagram with custom colors and fonts using skinparam.
PlantUML output:
@startuml
skinparam backgroundColor #AAFFFF
skinparam activity {
  StartColor red
  BarColor SaddleBrown
  EndColor Silver
  BackgroundColor Peru
  BackgroundColor<< Begin >> Olive
  BorderColor Peru
  FontName Impact
}
(*) --> "Climbs on Platform" << Begin >>
--> === S1 ===
--> Bows
--> === S2 ===
--> WavesArmes
--> (*)
@enduml

documents.instruction: Generate a comprehensive PlantUML activity diagram for a servlet container with multiple branches and synchronization points.
documents.input: Model the request handling flow in a servlet container
documents.output:
@startuml
title Servlet Container
(*) --> "ClickServlet.handleRequest()"
--> "new Page"
if "Page.onSecurityCheck" then
->[true] "Page.onInit()"
if "isForward?" then
->[no] "Process controls"
if "continue processing?" then
-->[yes] ===RENDERING===
else
-->[no] ===REDIRECT_CHECK===
endif
else
-->[yes] ===RENDERING===
endif
if "is Post?" then
-->[yes] "Page.onPost()"
--> "Page.onRender()" as render
--> ===REDIRECT_CHECK===
else
-->[no] "Page.onGet()"
--> render
endif
else
-->[false] ===REDIRECT_CHECK===
endif
if "Do redirect?" then
->[yes] "redirect request"
--> ==BEFORE_DESTROY===
else
if "Do Forward?" then
-left->[yes] "Forward request"
--> ==BEFORE_DESTROY===
else
-right->[no] "Render page template"
--> ==BEFORE_DESTROY===
endif
endif
--> "Page.onDestroy()"
-->(*)
@enduml

@startuml
(*) --> "Request password reset"
--> "Enter email"
if "Email exists?" then
->[yes] "Send reset link"
--> "Click reset link"
--> "Enter new password"
--> "Update password"
--> (*)
else
->[no] "Show error message"
--> (*)
endif
@enduml
documents.text:
Diagram type: activity_legacy
Instruction: Generate a PlantUML activity diagram for password reset flow.
PlantUML output:
@startuml
(*) --> "Request password reset"
--> "Enter email"
if "Email exists?" then
->[yes] "Send reset link"
--> "Click reset link"
--> "Enter new password"
--> "Update password"
--> (*)
else
->[no] "Show error message"
--> (*)
endif
@enduml

bill -> bob #005500 : hello from thread 2
bob -> george ** : create
return done in thread 2
return rc
bob -> george !! : delete
return success
@enduml

documents.instruction: Generate a state diagram with history and deep history markers
documents.output:
@startuml
[*] -> State1
State1 --> State2 : Succeeded
State1 --> [*] : Aborted
State2 --> State3 : Succeeded
State2 --> [*] : Aborted

state State3 {
  state "Accumulate Enough Data" as long1
  long1 : Just a test
  [*] --> long1
  long1 --> long1 : New Data
  long1 --> ProcessData : Enough Data
  State2 --> [H]: Resume
}

State3 --> State2 : Pause
State2 --> State3[H*]: DeepResume
State3 --> State3 : Failed
State3 --> [*] : Succeeded / Save Result
State3 --> [*] : Aborted
@enduml

@enduml

PrintReceipt --> EjectCard : receipt printed

documents.instruction: Pattern: valid RabbitMQ component syntax
documents.output:
@startuml
skinparam componentStyle rectangle
component "RabbitMQ Broker" as RabbitMQ {
  [image_queue]
  [name_queue]
  [bio_queue]
  [pictures_queue]
  [social_queue]
  [result_queue]
}

note right of RabbitMQ
  Exchanges (fanout, direct, topic) are conceptual.
  Represent them as separate components.
  Avoid stereotypes like <<fanout>>.
end note
@enduml

documents.instruction: Example: valid exchange representation without stereotypes
documents.output:
@startuml
component "RabbitMQ Broker" as RabbitMQ
component "Fanout Exchange" as Fanout

Fanout -down-> [image_queue]
Fanout -down-> [name_queue]
Fanout -down-> [bio_queue]
Fanout -down-> [pictures_queue]
Fanout -down-> [social_queue]
Fanout -down-> [result_queue]

note right of Fanout
  Exchanges must be independent components.
  Do NOT use stereotypes like <<fanout>>.
end note
@enduml

documents.instruction: Invalid syntax example to avoid
documents.text: Invalid syntax: stereotypes cannot be applied to nested elements. Use separate components.

documents.instruction: Repaired version of invalid exchange syntax

  [image_queue]
  [name_queue]
  [bio_queue]
  [pictures_queue]
  [social_queue]
  [result_queue]
}

component "Celebrity Names Exchange" as CelebrityExchange
CelebrityExchange -down-> [image_queue]
CelebrityExchange -down-> [name_queue]
CelebrityExchange -down-> [bio_queue]
CelebrityExchange -down-> [pictures_queue]
CelebrityExchange -down-> [social_queue]
CelebrityExchange -down-> [result_queue]

note right of CelebrityExchange
  Correct modeling of exchange.
  No invalid stereotypes.
end note
@enduml

documents.instruction: Rules for valid PlantUML component syntax
documents.output:
@startuml
component ServiceA
component "User Interface" as UI
component Backend {
  [InternalQueue]
  [Worker]
}

note bottom
  Rules:
  1. Stereotypes only apply to components, not nested items.
  2. Nested items must be [Elements], not typed declarations.
  3. Queues should use [queue_name] form.
  4. Do NOT invent syntax like: exchange X <<fanout>>.
end note
@enduml

documents.instruction: Correct grouping of nodes in a deployment diagram using a cloud environment.
documents.text: Demonstrates valid deployment syntax: grouping nodes inside node{"Cloud Environment"}. Cloud{} does NOT accept node declarations.

documents.instruction: Show difference between cloud component grouping and node deployment grouping.
documents.text: cloud{} only supports component-like elements. node{} must be used for deployment nodes. Demonstrates correct mixed usage.

documents.instruction: Deployment diagram containing multiple services and RabbitMQ queues.
documents.text: Queues should be represented as artifacts inside a node block. Valid deployment representation of a message broker.

documents.instruction: Invalid example: cloud grouping with node declarations.
documents.explanation: PlantUML rejects node declarations inside cloud{}. This forces fallback to component mode, causing syntax errors.

documents.instruction: Invalid syntax: RabbitMQ exchange stereotype misuse.
documents.explanation: PlantUML does not support nested elements with stereotypes such as <<fanout>>. Exchanges must be separate components or artifacts.

documents.instruction: Corrected exchange modeling in deployment diagrams.
documents.text: Exchanges should be modeled as separate nodes or components, not stereotypes. Demonstrates valid queue routing pattern.

documents.instruction: Minimal deployment diagram with proper syntax and mode enforcement.
documents.text: PlantUML requires at least one link to reliably infer deployment mode instead of component mode.

documents.instruction: Full multi-service cloud deployment with message broker (fixed version).
documents.input: Celebrity recognition pipeline using RabbitMQ and external APIs.
documents.output:
@startuml
skinparam node {
  BackgroundColor #F8F8E8
  BorderColor #555555
}

title Celebrity Recognition System - Deployment Diagram

node "Cloud Environment" as Cloud {
  node "Gradio Interface App" as GradioInterfaceApp
  node "Celebrity Recognition App" as CelebrityRecognitionApp
  node "Information Assembler App" as InformationAssemblerApp
  node "Bio Retrieval App" as BioRetrievalApp
  node "Social Media Retrieval App" as SocialMediaApp
  node "Recent Pictures Retrieval App" as RecentPicturesRetrievalApp

  node "RabbitMQ Broker" as RabbitMQ {
    artifact image_queue
    artifact name_queue
    artifact bio_queue
    artifact pictures_queue
    artifact social_queue
    artifact result_queue
  }
}

cloud "External APIs" as External {
  node "Image Recognition API" as ImageAPI
  node "Wikipedia Infobox API" as WikiAPI
  node "Social Media API" as SocialAPI
}

GradioInterfaceApp --> RabbitMQ : publish images / receive results
CelebrityRecognitionApp --> RabbitMQ : consume images / publish names
BioRetrievalApp --> RabbitMQ : consume names / publish bios
SocialMediaApp --> RabbitMQ : consume names / publish social info
RecentPicturesRetrievalApp --> RabbitMQ : consume names / publish pictures
InformationAssemblerApp --> RabbitMQ : consume all / publish results

CelebrityRecognitionApp --> ImageAPI : HTTP POST
BioRetrievalApp --> WikiAPI : HTTP GET
SocialMediaApp --> SocialAPI : HTTP GET
@enduml
documents.text: This is a canonical example of a large deployment diagram. Shows correct grouping, valid queue representation, external APIs, and required links.
